alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 18 at 3:00AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase stream flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Comus...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Moderate lowland flooding throughout the reach, with some rural roads flooded. Minor flooding in the lower parts of Winnemucca with storm drain backups. Main area impacted is between the Union Pacific Railroad and Second street beneath Interstate 80. Property damage in Winnemucca is minimal. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tonight. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Humboldt River Comus 9.5 6.7 Tue 2 am PD 9.6 10.2 10.4 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM PDT.
